com.siperian.bdd.userexits.datamodel

Interface BDDObject

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CustomizableBDDObject

    public interface BDDObject

    Representation of a BDD data object for use in a user exit. All objects defined in Subject Area (primary object and all children) are represented by this object.

    Operations and parameters in this interface assume that the user exit implementer uses the BDD configuraiton definitions to view the data structure, so names of operations and attributes corresponds to BDD application attributes.

      Checks whether the setValue operation can be performed with the specified columnUID In some cases (security, architectual limits) column value change will not be allowed for this object.

    • Method Detail

      • getObjectName

        String getObjectName()
        Returns:
        Returns the name of the object - name attribute in tag defining either primary object or child

      • getValue

        Object getValue(String columnUID)
        Returns the value of a column in the current object.
        Parameters:
        columnUID - - column UID in form similar to column definition in BDD Configuration
        Returns:
        value of column in the current object.

      • getOldValue

        Object getOldValue(String columnUID)
        Returns previous value of a column in the current object before the object
        Parameters:
        columnUID - - column UID in form similar to column definition in BDD Configuration
        Returns:
        old value of column in the current object.

      • isChanged

        boolean isChanged()
        Checks whether object is changed
        Returns:
        true if object is changed and false otherwise

      • getSystemValue

        Object getSystemValue(String columnUID)

        Returns the value of a system column in the current object identified by columnUID.

        Note: the list of all available system column names can be accessed by getSystemColumns operation.

        Parameters:
        columnUID - - column UID in form similar to column definition in BDD Configuration
        Returns:
        value of column in the current object.

      • setValue

        void setValue(String columnUID,
              Object value)
        Sets the value of column in current object.
        Parameters:
        columnUID - - column UID in form similar to column definition in BDD Configuration
        value - - new value to set

      • canSetValue

        boolean canSetValue(String columnUID,
                    Object value)
        Checks whether the setValue operation can be performed with the specified columnUID In some cases (security, architectual limits) column value change will not be allowed for this object. It is highly recomended for user exit code implementer to check availability of operation before executing it.
        Parameters:
        columnUID - - column UID in form similar to column definition in BDD Configuration
        value - - value that user exit whants to set
        Returns:
        true if setValue operation can be done sucessfully

      • getColumns

        List<String> getColumns()
        Returns:
        Returns the list of all column UIDs that are avialable to access from current object.

      • getSystemColumns

        List<String> getSystemColumns()
        Returns:
        Returns the list of system column UIDs that are avialable to access from current object.

      • getChangedColumns

        List<String> getChangedColumns()
        Returns:
        Returns the list of all columns that have been modified and have changes to be persisted. Note that columns modified from user exit code are also treated as modified columns

      • isDirtyColumn

        boolean isDirtyColumn(String columnUID)
        Checks whether column specified by columnUID has changes.
        Parameters:
        columnUID - - column UID in form similar to column definition in BDD Configuration
        Returns:
        true if column specified by columnUID is changed

      • getChildren

        List<BDDObject> getChildren(String childName)
        Returns all child objects with specified name for the current object. Primary object in BDD Configuration can have child objects in accordance to BDD Configuration specification. Children are grouped by child object definitions (one2ManyChild, many2ManyChild ... tags and every child definition has attribute name.
        Parameters:
        childName - - value of name attribute in child definition.
        Returns:
        the list of child objects.

      • getChangedChildren

        List<ChangedBDDObject> getChangedChildren(String childName,
                                          boolean getNewlyAddedChildren,
                                          boolean getRemovedChildren,
                                          boolean getUpdatedChildren)
        Returns all changed children or grandchildren objects with the specified name for the current object. List includes children that are newly added, deleted, or updated. User can select what type of changes should be included in this list. For example, user can request only newly added children or combination of removed and updated children. This method can be used for retrieving either changed children or grandchildren. Primary object in BDD Configuration can have child objects in accordance to BDD Configuration specification. Children are grouped by child object definitions (one2ManyChild, many2ManyChild ... tags and every child or grandchild definition has attribute name.
        Parameters:
        childName - - value of name attribute in child or grandchild definition.
        getNewlyAddedChildren - - should the list of changed children include newly added children
        getRemovedChildren - - should the list of changed children include removed children
        getUpdatedChildren - - should the list of changed children include updated children
        Returns:
        the list of changed children or grandchildren objects for the current object.

      • createChild

        BDDObject createChild(String childName,
                      Map<String,Object> values)
        Creates new child in a child group named childName with the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        childName - - child group name - name attribute in BDD Configuration definition of child
        values - - pre-set of column values for child object
        Returns:
        - object created

      • canCreateChild

        boolean canCreateChild(String childName,
                       Map<String,Object> values)
        Checks whether createChild will be succesfull with specified childName and values.
        Parameters:
        childName - - child group name - name attribute in BDD Configuration definition of child
        values - - pre-set of column values for child object
        Returns:
        true if child creation with such parameters are available

      • removeChild

        void removeChild(BDDObject child)
        Removes a child object from current object's children list.
        Parameters:
        child - - reference to child to remove

      • canRemoveChild

        boolean canRemoveChild(BDDObject child)
        Checks if removeChild will be sucessful for object parameter.
        Parameters:
        child - - reference to child to remove
        Returns:
        true if child can be removed

      • isCreated

        boolean isCreated()
        Returns:
        Checks if current object is new (not persisted yet).

      • isRemoved

        Returns:
        Checks if current object is marked to be deleted.

      • isMarkedForSave

        boolean isMarkedForSave()
        Returns:
        Checks if current object is marked for save.
